answers.answer: Hi,Hope you are feeling better.It is important to find out the cause of neuropathy in your case. Diabetes and B12 deficiency are the common causes which should be ruled out first. There are motor and sensory nerves. Stimulation of motor nerve results in muscle contraction while sensory nerves carry sensory information like pain, touch, pin *****, heat and cold sensations to the brain.At this point it is difficult to tell if the sensory defect will be progressive or not as the cause has not been identified as yet.

question: I have been falling down, having severe migranes and numbness and pains in my legs. I have neuropathy in my lower legs. I had a EMG study done and it showed that four of the nerves in each of my legs are having no reation at all. The doctor says this is a sensory defect. What does this mean, and will my pain get worse?
title: neuropathy in lower legs
